column1: #Text=We obtained a high-quality polycrystalline Y2Ir2O7 sample using Y2O3 (99.999%; Alfa Aesar) and IrO2 (99.9%; Sigma Aldrich) powders.
#Text=As IrO2 evaporates easily during sintering, we used 4–10% more IrO2 than suggested by the stoichiometric ratio, Y2O3: IrO2 = 1:2.
#Text=The mixture was pelletized and calcinated in a box furnace at 760 °C for 48 h.
#Text=After re-grinding and re-pelletizing, several annealing cycles were performed at temperatures between 900 °C and 1030 °C, each for 48 h.
#Text=High-density targets were prepared for optical experiments by pelletizing Y2Ir2O7 powder using a high-pressure anvil (NCAP-035; Nanki Engineering) operating at 4.3 GPa.
#Text=Samples with densities >87% were polished to render the surfaces shiny and flat (see Supplementary Note 6 for details).
